instrupy.radiometer_model.RadiometerModel¶

class instrupy.radiometer_model.RadiometerModel(name=None, mass=None, volume=None, power=None, orientation=None, fieldOfViewGeometry=None, sceneFieldOfViewGeometry=None, maneuver=None, pointingOption=None, dataRate=None, bitsPerPixel=None, antenna=None, operatingFrequency=None, system=None, scan=None, targetBrightnessTemp=None, _id=None)[source]¶

A radiometer class estimating observation data-metrics.

Variables

  • name (str) – Full name of the instrument.

  • mass (float) – Total mass (kg) of this entity.

  • volume (float) – Total volume (m3) of this entity.

  • power (float) – Nominal operating power (W).

  • orientation (instrupy.util.Orientation) – Orientation of the instrument.

  • fieldOfView (instrupy.util.ViewGeometry) – Field of view of instrument specification (SphericalGeometry and Orientation).

  • sceneFieldOfView – Scene field of view specification (SphericalGeometry and Orientation).

  • maneuver (instrupy.util.Maneuver) – Maneuver specification of the instrument.

  • fieldOfRegard (list, instrupy.util.ViewGeometry) – Field of regard of the instrument taking into account the sensor FOV and manueverability of the satellite-sensor system. Note that this shall be a list in order to accommodate non-intersecting view-geometries.

  • pointing_option (list, orbitpy.util.Orientation) – List of Orientation objects which specify the orientations into which the instrument-axis can be maneuvered. The orientation must be specified in the NADIR_POINTING frame.

  • dataRate (float) – Rate of data recorded (Mega-bits-per-sec) during nominal operations.

  • bitsPerPixel (int) – Number of bits encoded per pixel of image.

  • antenna (instrupy.util.Antenna) – Antenna specifications.

  • operatingFrequency (float) – Operating radar center frequency in (Hertz).

  • system – Radiometer system object.

  • scan (instrupy.radiometer_model.FixedScan or instrupy.radiometer_model.CrossTrackScan or instrupy.radiometer_model.ConicalScan.) – Scan object.

  • targetBrightnessTemp (float) – Target brightness temperature in Kelvin.

  • _id (str or int) – Unique identifier.

Varytype system

instrupy.radiometer_model.TotalPowerRadiometerSystem or instrupy.radiometer_model.UnbalancedDikeRadiometerSystem or instrupy.radiometer_model.BalancedDikeRadiometerSystem or instrupy.radiometer_model.NoiseAddingRadiometerSystem
